author: Susan Allen, Vermont News & Media
title: New two-year Vermont study details suicide numbers, related factors | News | reformer.com
text:
About 246 Vermonters look their lives in 2020-21, most of them men (eight in 10) over the age of 25.
That was among the findings of an extensive study released this fall by the Vermont Department of Health that also found the highest rate of suicide among those who are single, never married, or divorced; those with a high school education or less; and those who live in rural areas of the state. Veterans had a suicide rate more than triple non-veterans, the study found.
The report is driven by numbers, but the authors noted the humanity behind the statistics.
“This report is dedicated to the many Vermonters who have died by suicide and their loved ones. While the work is data-driven, we must not lose sight of the fact that each data point is far more than that,” the report opened. “We believe that the findings and recommendations within this document are valuable to informing our collective work to prevent future losses of life due to suicide.”
The report took two years to create, using data was collected during the pandemic years, although it’s unclear what impact COVID had on the suicide rate.
On an optimistic note, although it's too early to predict trends, the numbers will be down for 2022; they are unknown for 2023, according to Stephanie Busch of the Health Department.
Funded in part by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, this first-ever project was spearheaded by the Health Department, with participation from the Department of Mental Health, Area Agencies on Aging, The Green Mountain Care Board, and other state departments.
The group documented the statistics and put forward recommendations for trying to reduce the upward trend.
"It was a massive project," Busch said Thursday. She said the department is trying to get the information out to all the agencies and communities in Vermont, adding, "All communities are impacted by a suicide death and we all have a part in coming together and facing suicide prevention."
She said it's important that people who are struggling – and those around them who recognize that struggle – know that help is available and how to access it.
"It’s OK to ask for help," she said, "and help is there. People don’t have to be alone." [Information on locating confidential help 24/7 can be found at the bottom of this story.]
According to the findings, firearms account for more than half of suicide deaths, followed by hanging and poisoning.
About 76 percent had health insurance and had seen a medical professional within a year of death (35 percent had been to an emergency room within a year of death) — most within a few months of passing. Within a year of death, 17 percent of people who died interacted with emergency medical services, the study found.
In addition, according to the report, people who died by suicide were more likely to have a prescription for a controlled substance within a year of death.
Of people who died by suicide, 45 percent experienced a crisis within two weeks of death (relationship, financial or health problem, for example); 22 percent had a court case within a year of death — often relief from abuse orders, a recent divorce or dissolution, felonies, misdemeanors, and civil suspensions. A significant percentage were 65 and older.
Vermont data shows that Black, Indigenous, People of Color (BIPOC) and youth populations have high suicide morbidity (health issue), but the data doesn’t demonstrate high mortality (deaths). Vermont data also shows that individuals who identify as LGBTQAI+ have high suicide morbidity, but the data sources used in this analysis may not reliably capture sexual orientation or gender identity.
Among the recommendations (see the full report for a complete list and details):
• Link all levels of care — primary care, emergency departments, inpatient programs, emergency medical services, mental health services, substance use services, pharmacies, geriatric specialists and telehealth/telemental health providers — aiming for a Zero Suicide framework. Expand screening, intervention and prevention.
• Better integrate state and local prevention and response efforts. Collaborate with the Veteran’s Affairs and Vermont National Guard to expand identification and support of service members and veterans at risk of suicide, including younger veterans and their families. Expand supports for telemental health when treating suicidality.
• Continue and expand data collection.
"This report is the first of its kind of us," Busch said. She said all the different groups involved are still studying the information and working on ways to use the information going forward.
“Suicide is an important public health issue facing Vermont. Approximately 120 Vermonters die by suicide each year, and Vermont’s suicide rate has been increasing over the past 18 years,” the report stated. But the problem is far from limited to those who take their lives. “For each of these suicide deaths, countless other Vermont family members, friends and colleagues are greatly impacted.”
More information is available at facingsuicidevt.com/ . The full report from the Health Department can be found at healthvermont.gov/sites/default/files/document/HSI-Suicide-Data-Linkage-Project-9.12.23.pdf .
If you or someone you know needs help, dial 988 for the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline, or text VT to 741-741 for the Crisis Text Line.

author: 鉅亨網新聞中心
title: 盤中速報 - 智通(8932)大漲7.3%，報169元
text:
盤中速報 - 智通(8932)大漲7.3%，報169元
鉅亨網新聞中心
智通(8932-TW)31日10:55股價上漲11.5元，報169.0元，漲幅7.3%，成交6,520張。
智通(8932-TW)所屬產業為其他業，主要業務為各種拉鍊、拉鍊配件、拉鍊機零件之製造加工買賣。前項產品之進出口貿易。資訊軟體服務。
近5日股價上漲11.31%，櫃買市場加權指數下跌0.31%，股價漲幅表現優於大盤。

author: sina.com.cn
title: 中国科大提出单原子催化剂设计全新理论模型|中国科大_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
中国科学技术大学路军岭教授团队联合武晓君教授及中国科学院大连化学物理研究所杨冰副研究员，创新性地将前线分子轨道理论引入单原子催化剂设计中，成功研发出兼具高活性和高稳定性的单原子加氢催化剂，实现了前线分子轨道理论在多相催化中的实验佐证与突破性应用。该项研究为高活性、高稳定性单原子催化剂设计提供了一个全新的理论模型，有望为人工智能高通量筛选催化剂奠定新的理论基础，并大幅度加快高活性、高稳定性催化剂的开发，缩短其工业化应用进程。4月2日，相关成果在线发表于《自然》。
　　单原子催化剂凭借其最大化的金属原子利用率、量子化的电子结构及独特的物理化学性质，在多相催化、能源转化、环境治理及生物医学等领域展现出广阔应用前景。自中国科学家率先提出单原子催化概念以来，该领域已成为国际催化领域研究的前沿。
　　从本质上说，单原子催化剂的活性和稳定性分别是由金属-底物分子和金属-载体相互作用决定的。然而，现有研究很少在电子轨道层面上对该两组相互作用进行解析和设计催化剂，而是习惯性地把催化剂的活性/稳定性与实验上测得的金属原子价态进行关联。目前，人们仍然缺乏一个能够描述单原子催化剂活性和稳定性的统一理论模型。
　　该工作中，路军岭团队在14种半导体载体表面构建了34种钯单原子催化剂。他们通过调控载体种类与尺寸，实现了对载体最低未占分子轨道（LUMO）能级位置的精准调控，并利用紫外可见吸收谱和Mott-Schottky　测试实现了对其LUMO能级位置的精准测量。杨冰团队利用高分辨电镜确认了钯原子的原子分散状态。红外和光电子能谱表征则发现随氧化物尺寸的减小，钯原子的价态逐步升高，与纳米氧化物的电子相互作用逐步增强。
　　在乙炔选择性加氢反应中，研究发现当氧化锌、氧化钴等载体尺寸降至纳米级时，钯单原子催化剂的活性显著提升20倍以上，并展现出更优异的稳定性。进一步研究发现，上述钯单原子催化剂的活性与其价态并无直接关系，而与实验上测得的载体LUMO能级位置呈线性关系。
　　武晓君团队通过理论计算揭示了金属-载体及金属-分子间的前线轨道耦合内在机制，并证实了前线分子轨道理论在单原子催化中完全可行，为高活性、高稳定性单原子催化剂设计提供了一个全新的理论模型。
　　审稿过程中，审稿人对该工作做了高度评价，认为“这是一个令人激动的工作，通过实验和理论建立了金属-载体电子相互作用以及分子吸附强度的内在关联……是见过金属-载体电子相互作用讨论最为透彻的工作”，并认为“作者提出的观点非常吸引人”。(记者　汪乔）

author: Shinu
title: #70 Un atentado islamista durante la misa de Navidad deja más de 160 cristianos asesinados en Nigeria
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#0](c0#c-0) Ese titular es tendencioso y confuso, y probablemente seas consciente. El ataque no fue durante una misa, como quiere dar a entender, si no que se atacó una serie de aldeas de manera coordinada. Y además, el factor religioso no es el único relevante, y tampoco está plenamente confirmado.
Hay fuentes mucho más serias, informadas y rigurosas que la que has mandado...
[#10](c10#c-10) Resulta difícil creer que puedan existir fuentes más serias leyendo maravillas cosas como:
La reciente matanza sucedida en Navidad confirma lo que anuncian las estadísticas: el cristianismo es la religión más perseguida en el mundo. Y no se limita solamente a esta región de África, sino que ocurre en Asia y Medio Oriente. Hace poco a cristianos perseguidos por el régimen comunista chino se les negó asilo en la España de Pedro Sánchez y el PSOE. Solo una lo pudo obtener porque su salud le impedía subir al avión donde la deportaban.
Todo ello, mientras las pateras siguen llegando a España, posiblemente con insurgentes tan radicales como los que masacran a los cristianos en Nigeria y sin el amparo para los cristianos que huyen de estos.
[#65](c65#c-65) Las muertes no son sensacionalistas, la noticia es sensacionalista, y su falta de rigor, una falta de respeto a los que han sido asesinados. Además de aprovechar que el Pisuerga pasa por Valladolid para seguir esparciendo odio y desinformación...
No sé tú, pero yo este tipo de cosas ni las tolero ni me quedo callada, prefiero no ser cómplice de estas miserias.
Mira, igual en que en Gaza, pero estos no lo llaman masacre.
https://www.lavanguardia.com/internacional/20231217/9456963/iglesia-denuncia-israel-mato-sangre-fria-dos-feligresas-gaza.html
https://es.zenit.org/2023/12/12/22-cristianos-muertos-en-gaza-cohete-sin-detonar-hallado-en-parroquia/

Esto es una masacre genocida por supuesto, ejem
[#2](c2#c-2) .... Pro no es comparable. Si acaso, comparable a la masacre de Hamas.
[#61](c61#c-61) Con Israel si, con Gaza no, mediáticamente deberíamos estar recibiendo un bombardeo de lavado de cara de Israel, pero es al contrario. Lo que esté bien o mal no me meto, no soy experto, pero la actitud de los medios ha cambiado y eso me inquieta.
Es como si dentro de un mes encontramos todos los medios diciendo que Aznar ha sido el peor presidente, que hipotecó a España para décadas. Sería inquietante, llevan décadas lavándole la cara a Aznar y que cambien de rumbo significaría que algo ha pasado o que está habiendo algún cambio de poderes de influencia.
[#9](c9#c-9) bueno. Entérate quién financio al valeroso pueblo de Afganistán y sus valerosos guerreros los muyahidines( les dedicaron Rambo iii y todo), o quien armó y financio a Irak, a estos que ves ahora este terrible atentado de la noticia, quien los organizo y financió, ... Después nos vuelves a contar estás cosas. Y si sigues pensando que está irán detrás de todo pq es omnipresente vale. Si ves q algún otro estado puede estar implicado, fijate quién lo arma y financia. Un saludo.
[#13](c13#c-13) lo se y lo he criticado 100 millones de veces, dinero de EEUU y Arabia Saudita y Pakistán.
Pero eso no les importa para llamarlos partisanos, "que en Europa les habría llamado partisanos y que habrían luchado contra los nazis"
Eso es mierda, el fanatismo religioso no atiende a razones.
Al menos tu comentario muestra algo de vergüenza de esa gente... Algo es algo.
[#20](c20#c-20) pues mira otra vez la captura que mandas, pq es exactamente lo que estoy diciendo. Afganistán era un país más adelantado que España y las mujeres iban sin velo. El tío Sam puso a la derecha religiosa conservadora, o lo que viene a ser los fascistas de toda la vida, pero en musulmán, a levantarse en armas... Cómo en Irak, libia, Egipto, Ucrania... Mismo proceder en todos lados, mismo resultado en todos lados. Países de mierda con gobiernos autoritarios y la población paupérrima y reprimida. Eso es el tío Sam.

https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guerra_de_Afganist%C3%A1n_(1978-1992)

[#31](c31#c-31) entérate lo que era Afganistán antes del 92.
Era un estado laico. En el año 90 la mayoría del profesorado eran mujeres, por ejemplo, que estaba integrada en el mundo laboral.
Y la revolución hostigada por el tío Sam puso a los integristas islámicos. Los valerosos muyahidines, como dijeron en Rambo 3, que les dedicaron.

Segundo:
Lo de que Afghanistan era laico , mujeres sin velo etc . se ha mostrado erróneo, solo era en Khabul . En las zonas agrarias (el resto del país) era anticuado respecto a esto .
Pero es un lío y al final no sabes lo que es verdad o no , internet está lleno de información contradictoria .

https://www.indy100.com/showbiz/rambo-iii-afghanistan-mujahideen-taliban-b1904082
[#69](c69#c-69) Esos ojitos no han podido ver algo que jamás ha ocurrido:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rambo_III#Dedication (apartado "Dedication")
The film ends with the on-screen caption, "This film is dedicated to the gallant people of Afghanistan." At some point after the September 11 attacks, an urban legend began that the dedication had actually read "... to the brave Mujahideen fighters" when the film was released in theaters, but then changed to "the gallant people of Afghanistan" after the 2001 attacks, since the Mujahideen were now associated to some extent with the Taliban. This urban legend has been repeated by some scholars. However, this is untrue, and some reviews of the film upon its release even mentioned the "gallant people of Afghanistan" dedication.
Es decir, o bien crees haberlo visto (podría ser efecto Mandela) o bien simplemente estás mintiendo.
[#71](c71#c-71) Pues entonces estás mintiendo. No hay ninguna versión de la película en la que aparezca dicho texto, y si te fijas la captura que se comparte online en la que sale el texto de los muyhidines siempre es la misma en el mismo frame exacto. Eso es debido a que la gente siempre comparte la misma captura editada.

No se trata de liberar nada, cada ataque sirve para atraer radicales y causar estragos en los no creyetes.

https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archivo:Reagan_sitting_with_people_from_the_Afghanistan-Pakistan_region_in_February_1983.jpg

Es decir para vosotros el fanatismo islámico viene de un supuesto apoyo de EEUU a hamas y no de irán...

Los talibanes son partisanos radicalizados por EEUU.
Los hermanos musulmanes se radicalizado jugando call of duty.
Pero jamás lobbys, poderes y dinero de países radicales apoyan a estos grupos de mierda.

Aunque es posible que esa respuesta no tenga nada que ver con su comentario y simplemente sea una patética y lamentable pataleta porque no te ha gustado su respuesta.
[#17](c17#c-17) "por no sé que historia".
¿O por "no quiero saber"? Te dan la oportunidad de aprender, no la desperdicies.

Es una noticia de 160 muertos a manos de yihadistas por ser infieles.

author: ExpressDigest
title: Gwyneth Paltrow shares a cozy coffee catch-up with childhood bestie Mary Wigmore in Los Angeles
text:
By Deirdre Durkan-simonds and Justin Enriquez For Dailymail.com
Published: 20:58 GMT, 14 March 2024 | Updated: 21:11 GMT, 14 March 2024
Gwyneth Paltrow was seen catching up with her childhood best friend, Mary Wigmore, over coffee in Los Angeles, California on Thursday morning.
While walking out of a café together, the Goop founder and film director, both 51, were seen chatting away as they held onto their warm beverages in the parking lot.
For their laid-back outing, the Oscar winner sported a black t-shirt, matching leggings and a grey sweatshirt wrapped around her slender waist.
She completed her casual ensemble with a pair of aviator sunglasses over her light blue eyes and a pair of charcoal grey sneakers with neon yellow accents.
Gwyneth Paltrow was seen catching up with her childhood best friend, Mary Wigmore, over coffee in Los Angeles , California on Thursday morning
Her signature sunny blonde tresses cascaded down her shoulders in loose waves as she strolled back to her car, alongside her longtime pal.
Paltrow, who is married to Brad Falchuk, showcased her natural beauty with little makeup.
Wigmore wore a crewneck sweatshirt, blue baseball cap, leggings and tennis shoes.
In 2020, Paltrow described Wigmore as her ‘dearest’ and ‘oldest’ pal, alongside a sweet birthday tribute.
At the time, she also shared throwback images of them together from their first day of elementary school, playing soccer as kids on the same team and family vacations.
Over the years, the mother-of-two has talked about the positive effect that Wigmore and her other lifelong friends have had on her life.
‘It has helped my life and attitude that I’ve had the same friends for most of my life. I met one, Mary Wigmore, on the first day of kindergarten, aged four, and three or four others I met at the age of five,’ she told The Sun in 2011.
She continued: ‘We have been very close throughout and have all heard each other’s stories about growing up… the laughter between us has been the most important thing, at any age.’
While walking out of a café together, the Goop founder and film director, both 51, were seen chatting away as they held onto their warm beverages in the parking lot
In 2020, Paltrow described Wigmore as her ‘dearest’ and ‘oldest’ pal, alongside a sweet birthday tribute
Wigmore seen in the front row (on the far left next to Stella McCartney) at Paltrow’s bachelorette weekend in Mexico in 2018
Wigmore is also a contributor for Gwyneth’s wellness and lifestyle brand and company, Goop, and has written a few articles for the website.
Mary is a success in Hollywood in her own right as she starred in Shallow Hal and The Royal Tenenbaums.
She has since moved on to directing as she directed a season 9 episode of American Horror Story – titled Slashdance – in 2019 in addition to an episode of 9-1-1 that same year.
Mary also seems to have a good working relationship with Gwyneth’s ex Chris Martin as she has directed several music videos for his band Coldplay including 2014’s Midnight, 2006’s The Hardest Part and lyric video for Hypnotised in 2017.
:
Gwyneth Paltrow shares a cozy coffee catch-up with childhood bestie Mary Wigmore in Los Angeles
***
Read more at DailyMail.co.uk

author: webinfo@adnkronos.com (Web Info)
title: India, visibilità zero per nebbia al nord: rinviati oltre 100 voli e treni
text:
(Adnkronos) - E' una nebbia fittissima quella che avvolge l'India settentrionale, causando un vero caos nel settore dei trasporti per la visibilità ''pari a zero'', come l'ha definita il Dipartimento meteorologico indiano (imd). Più di cento gli aerei che non sono riusciti a partire in orario dall'aeroporto internazionale di Nuova Delhi, così come decine i treni in ritardo o riprogrammati per la mancata visibilità nell'area. Lo rende noto l'agenzia di stampa indiana Pti, mentre il servizio meteorologico indiano annuncia che è prevista nebbia anche per i prossimi giorni.
Secondo l'Imd, questa mattina circa nove aeroporti, tra cui quello di Nuova Delhi, hanno registrato visibilità pari a zero. Lo scalo internazionale dalla capitale indiana ha avvisato i passeggeri che potrebbero registrarsi disagi soprattutto per i voli non conformi al sistema radar che consente atterraggi automatici in caso di visibilità molto scarsa. L'aeroporto di Nuova Delhi gestisce circa 1.300 voli al giorno.
La qualità dell'aria di Nuova Delhi è stata classificata come "molto scarsa". L'umidità è stata registrata al 100% stamattina.

author: Kristin
title: Top 10 Reader Favorite Recipes in 2023
text:
Happy (nearly) new year — I hope you had a wonderful and magical holiday season!
2023 has been an incredible year full of very high-highs, and some lows as well. We really hunkered down in 2020 and much of 2021, so this felt like our first year of getting back into the swing of things travel-wise, which was a real highlight. As a family we visited San Diego, Vail, Denver, Albuquerque, Minneapolis, and the Gulf Shores (take me back!) Professionally, I was lucky enough to travel to Austin, Washington DC, Nashville, and the Smoky Mountains of Tennessee.
This was the first year we’ve been able to travel without a lot of extra “stuff” that comes with having babies and toddlers (pack ‘n’ plays, diapers, bottles, etc.) which felt very strange (“why do we have so much extra trunk space?!” — me after packing the car up for a road trip, lol) and freeing.
That said, to my Mamas of itty bitty ones — time FLIES and before you know it you’ll be trading 2am feedings with 2pm coastal-mountain hikes. Hang in there! <3
In 2023 we said goodbye to beloved family members, and are getting ready to meet new family members in 2024. We all got Covid for the first time this past spring (10/10 do not recommend) and I worked through some debilitating health issues this fall that are thankfully, finally, resolving. I enter 2024 determined to never take good health for granted.
As a friend recently said, health is wealth!
All that said, I am so excited to enter a new year and see how my kids learn and grow, where life takes us, and of course dish up another delicious year of easy gluten recipes using everyday ingredients here on Iowa Girl Eats!
Which brings me to my favorite post of the year — a recap of YOUR favorite new recipes as determined by clicks, views and shares! These include
healthy spins on heavier recipes, my boys’ favorite breakfast, my personal favorite recipe from 2023, and this viral recipe.
As we head into 2024, I want to hear from you: what kinds of recipes are you looking for? How can I help?
Lastly, are you signed up for my free email list? If not, sign up! It’s an easy way to stay in touch. :)
Top Recipes from Previous Years
Top 10 in 2022 Top 10 in 2021 Top 10 in 2020 Top 10 in 2019 Top 10 in 2018 Top 10 in 2017 Top 10 in 2016 Top 10 in 2015
Top 10 Reader Favorite Recipes in 2023
#1 Crock Pot Buffalo Chicken Dip
This
existing recipe got a much needed photo upgrade in 2023 and it exploded in popularity afterwards (what can I say, photographing orange food is very, very hard!) Equal parts spicy, cheesy, and creamy, it is addictingly delicious.
#2 Baked Chicken Thighs
There’s always a recipe that goes viral on IGE each year, and in 2023 it was
Baked Chicken Thighs. (In 2022 it was the Jennifer Aniston Salad, in 2021 it was Gnocchi Chicken Pot Pie, and in 2020 it was Cheeseburger Quesadillas, ICYWW!) I make this recipe almost weekly because its insanely easy and my family demolishes the entire pan with rave reviews each and every time.
#3 Perfect Gluten Free Pancakes
Any time I get a new review on my
Perfect Gluten Free Pancakes I do a little dance. It’s uncommon that a non-savory recipe cracks the top 10 most popular recipes each year, which is a testament to how fantastic these pancakes are.
#4 High Protein Overnight Oats
2023 was the year of protein. Everywhere I turned — whether it be social media, magazines, or the news — the benefits of protein-packed meals were being touted.
High Protein Overnight Oats kind of feels like cheating because they’re packed with protein yet taste like cake and require zero protein powder or uncommon ingredients. Truly the most perfect breakfast or snack idea.
#5 Mini Egg Bites
Mini Egg Bites were another crazy popular, high-protein breakfast / snack recipe in 2023. This recipe also contains an ingredient that had itself an entire MOMENT in 2023. Can you guess what it is?
#6 Chickpea Chicken Salad
Inexpensive, full of plant-based-protein, healthy, crunchy, and fresh are all words I’d use to describe the sixth most popular recipe in 2023.
Chickpea “Chicken” Salad tastes like regular chicken salad except it’s completely vegan. My Dad — who I’m not sure had ever looked at a chickpea before this recipe — makes it every single week for lunch, if that tells you how tasty it is!
#7 Gluten Free Pizza Crust
The comments I routinely get on my
Gluten Free Pizza Crust recipe are why I do what I do. Reading: “Thank you for saving pizza night!!” or “My husband looked at me and said, “This tastes just like real pizza!””, and “I am in tears … these little wins mean the world” thrill me to hear. Food is so emotional and to be able to help my fellow g-free-ers with a pizza crust recipe that tastes like “regular” hand tossed pizza was definitely a highlight of 2023.
#8 Gluten Free Cornbread
I grew up eating Jiffy cornbread mix and this homemade
Gluten Free Cornbread recipe is a dead ringer — I’m so glad it cracked the top 10 in 2023 despite being shared just a month or two ago! The perfect thing to pair with chili, soups, and BBQ.
#9 Gluten Free Focaccia
Gluten Free Focaccia is your 9th favorite recipe from 2023, and my personal favorite recipe from 2023. Words cannot describe how meaningful it is to have a recipe for soft and fluffy gluten free bread that calls for a handful of everyday ingredients. If there’s one recipe I urge you to make from this list, it’s Gluten Free Focaccia!
#10 Gluten Free Strawberry Muffins
I’m not a huge sweets girl so trust me when I tell you that the recipe for
Gluten Free Strawberry Muffins is utter perfection. Just the right amount of sweetness, soft and fluffy — I lost track of how many batches I made this summer during peak strawberry season. Feel free to swap in other berries, as the base muffin recipe is just fantastic!
Wishing you a happy, safe, and healthy 2024 — thank you from the bottom of my heart for visiting me here at Iowa Girl Eats, and cooking my recipes!
